input.system: You are an expert in computer science and Python programming.
input.user: What is the difference between a list and a tuple in Python?

items.expected_output: Lists in Python are mutable, meaning their elements can be changed. Tuples, on the other hand, are immutable. Also, lists use square brackets [], while tuples use parentheses ().

input.system: You are a machine learning assistant. Provide accurate, concise answers.
input.user: What is overfitting in machine learning?

items.expected_output: Overfitting is when a model learns the training data too well, including noise, and fails to generalize to new data. It performs well on training data but poorly on unseen data.
